subject: Re: [junit] Testing with a ResultSet
msgSnippet: ... You can find various prefabricated mock objects for JDBC within the Mock-Objects-Library (http://www.mockobjects.com/). Johannes
messageBody:
"Heath, Joseph" wrote:
>
> What about creating a MockResultSet that implements the ResultSet interface
> that has the behaviour you require. You only need to write the class to give
> the appearance of a 'real' ResultSet rather thatn the functionality.
> joe

You can find various prefabricated mock objects for JDBC within the
Mock-Objects-Library (http://www.mockobjects.com/).

Johannes
